docs.lead_paragraph: COUNCIL BLUFFS, Iowa - A couple of quick observations from Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton's first "Every County Counts" tour of Iowa, which will have her and her surrogates campaigning in all 99 counties of Iowa over the next five days.

headline.main: Clinton Hits Iowa With New Energy

docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton seems far more charged up, and her delivery is far crisper, than during her campaign events in New Hampshire on Saturday. Could it be that Des Moines Register endorsement?
docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton seems far more charged up, and her delivery is far crisper, than during her campaign events in New Hampshire on Saturday. Could it be that Des Moines Register endorsement?

docs.lead_paragraph: COUNCIL BLUFFS, Iowa -- One of Bill Clinton's political headaches during his 1992 campaign and his first years as president was Bob Kerrey, the Democratic senator and Vietnam veteran from Nebraska, who also ran for the 1992 nomination and was a tough critic of some of Mr. Clinton's personal and policy choices.
docs.abstract: In endorsing Hillary Clinton on Sunday, Bob Kerry, the former senator from Nebraska, said, "She has been standing up to the extreme wing of the Republican party for 15 years while they tried to tear her down, and you know what? She's still standing."
docs.snippet: In endorsing Hillary Clinton on Sunday, Bob Kerry, the former senator from Nebraska, said, "She has been standing up to the extreme wing of the Republican party for 15 years while they tried to tear her down, and you know what? She's still standing."

docs.lead_paragraph: “In politics, we have come very close to losing our democracy, not just in rigged rules and stolen elections but in the domination of politics by big money, the decline in participation by ordinary people, and the assault on basic constitutional liberties.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Jennifer Lee Dudeff and Geoffery Nelson Klein were married Saturday at Our Lady of Assumption Church in Woodbridge, Conn. The Rev. Robert J. Lord, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

docs.lead_paragraph:
What are so many crochet-hook-wielding, papermaking,
silversmithing handicrafters doing online? Trying to prove that the future of shopping — and of work — is all about the past.

docs.lead_paragraph: What you learn about people — and yourself — when you need them to donate an organ.
docs.snippet: What you learn about people — and yourself — when you need them to donate an organ.

docs.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES - Let's talk about the week that was. It's been almost all about Iowa this week, and you should get used to that. With less than three weeks to the caucuses, the candidates are in full campaign mode.

headline.main: The Week That Was, in Iowa

docs.abstract: Voters weigh their choices as the candidates fan out across the state in the final weeks of the campaign here.
docs.snippet: Voters weigh their choices as the candidates fan out across the state in the final weeks of the campaign here.

docs.lead_paragraph: Political campaigns and elected officials have used a variety of tactics over the years to keep students from voting. This is bad for politics and bad for the nation.
